clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Investigated for the treatment of cancer

contraindications.disease: Acute oral toxicity LD sub 50 sub in mouse 50 1 mg kg
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Camptothecin demonstrated strong anticancer activity in preliminary clinical trials but also low solubility and adverse drug reaction Camptothecin is believed to be a potent topoisomerase inhibitor that interferes with the essential function of topoisomerase in DNA replication

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Camptothecin
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Camptothecin
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Camptothecin
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta is combined with Camptothecin
